MemberSignature.Usage: iFixedTypeInfo.Invoke (pvInstance, memid, wFlags, pDispParams, pVarResult, pExcepInfo, puArgErr)

param.name: pvInstance
param.span: Pointer to an instance of the interface described by this type description.

span.span: Pointer to an instance of the interface described by this type description.

param.name: memid
param.span: Identifies the interface member.

span.span: Identifies the interface member.

param.name: wFlags
param.span: Flags describing the context of the invoke call, as follows: DISPATCH_METHOD if the member is accessed as a method.

span.span: Flags describing the context of the invoke call, as follows: DISPATCH_METHOD if the member is accessed as a method.

param.span: If there is ambiguity, both this and the DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET flag can be set.

span.span: If there is ambiguity, both this and the DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET flag can be set.

param.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET if the member is retrieved as a property or data member.

span.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYGET if the member is retrieved as a property or data member.

param.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT if the member is changed as a property or data member.

span.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT if the member is changed as a property or data member.

param.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF if the member is changed by using a reference assignment, rather than a value assignment.

span.span: DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF if the member is changed by using a reference assignment, rather than a value assignment.

param.span: This value is only valid when the property accepts a reference to an object.

span.span: This value is only valid when the property accepts a reference to an object.

param.name: pDispParams
param.span: Points to a structure that contains an array of arguments, an array of DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts of the number of elements in each array.

span.span: Points to a structure that contains an array of arguments, an array of DISPIDs for named arguments, and counts of the number of elements in each array.

param.name: pVarResult
param.span: Should be Null if the caller does not expect any result.

span.span: Should be Null if the caller does not expect any result.

param.span: Otherwise, it should be a pointer to the location at which the result is to be stored.

span.span: Otherwise, it should be a pointer to the location at which the result is to be stored.

param.span: If wFlags specifies DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT or DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF, pVarResultis ignored.

span.span: If wFlags specifies DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUT or DISPATCH_PROPERTYPUTREF, pVarResultis ignored.

param.name: pExcepInfo
param.span: Points to an exception information structure, which is filled in only if DISP_E_EXCEPTION is returned.

span.span: Points to an exception information structure, which is filled in only if DISP_E_EXCEPTION is returned.

param.span: If pExcepInfois Null on input, only an HRESULT error will be returned.

span.span: If pExcepInfois Null on input, only an HRESULT error will be returned.

param.name: puArgErr
param.span: If Invoke returns DISP_E_TYPEMISMATCH, puArgErr indicates the index (within rgvarg) of the argument with incorrect type.

span.span: If Invoke returns DISP_E_TYPEMISMATCH, puArgErr indicates the index (within rgvarg) of the argument with incorrect type.

param.span: If more than one argument returns an error, puArgErr indicates only the first argument with an error.

span.span: If more than one argument returns an error, puArgErr indicates only the first argument with an error.

param.span: Arguments in pDispParams->rgvarg appear in reverse order, so the first argument is the one having the highest index in the array.

span.span: Arguments in pDispParams->rgvarg appear in reverse order, so the first argument is the one having the highest index in the array.

param.span: Cannot be Null.

span.span: Cannot be Null.
